headline: Athlete Employment story
byline: By Melissa Wang Edited by Charlotte Li

body.value: Leadin. Something to draw the reader in. Graphics is the only visuals and words desk at the Spectator.
Nutgraf. What is the meat of the story? Why does this matter?

steps: Out of 478 Columbia Aathletes graduated in 2017-2019, around 44 percent44% of them pursued employment in the financial services and consulting industries.

Among 27 sports teams, Baseball, Lightweight Rowing, Men's Squash, Men's Tennis, Womenâ€™s Tennis, Lacrosse, and Volleyball has over 50 percent% of the team enter into a career in finance or consulting.
On the Men's tennis team, which has the highest turnout for a career in finance among the 27 teams, 9 of the 10 team members graduated in 2017-2019 went into a career in finance or consulting.
Only 7.6% of these athletes continued to play in professional sports after graduation, which is the 4th most popular career option among all athletes.

body.value: Melissa Wang is a Graphics reporter. She can be contacted at melissa.wang@columbiaspectator.com.
Charlotte Li is a Graphics deputy editor. She can be contacted at charlotte.li@columbiaspectator.com.
